binding.name: note
binding.literal: Carthage was founded in circa 814BC and destroyed by Rome in 146BC. It controlled a wide territory (mostly by sea): at its greatest extent this included areas of the coast of North Africa, Southern Spain, Malta, Gozo, Sardinia, Corsica, Western Sicily and the Balearic Islands.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Independent kingdom under the Orontid (circa 336-200BC) and Artaxiad (circa 190-1BC) dynasties.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Western Asia Minor kingdom centred on Pergamum circa 281-133BC

binding.name: note
binding.literal: Independent kingdom (circa 190-80BC) formerly part of the kingdom of Armenia and reabsorbed into that kingdom in the 80s BC.

binding.name: note
binding.literal: 1st century AD administrative district of Roman Cyprus

binding.name: note
binding.literal: The assembly of the Roman province of Syria, which celebrated games every five years in Antioch on the Orontes and issued coins in the name of the Koinon.
